title: Bug 18934: Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
OB: When opening the ImageAnalyzer example in Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only), the scrollbars are enabled and movable. However, they do not have any effect on the displayed image. Even when opening a small image, such as an icon, the scrollbars are present but don't serve any purpose, leading to confusion and misinterpretation.
EB: The scrollbars should be disabled in the ImageAnalyzer example.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Open the ImageAnalyzer example.
2. Observe the presence and movability of the scrollbars.
3. Notice that the scrollbars have no effect on the displayed image or its behavior.
4. Open a small image, such as an icon, and observe that the scrollbars are misleading and do not serve any purpose.
